content.rendered:
Hello and welcome to This Week in Genesis (#23) featuring a fantastic, ‘name your own price’ e-commerce theme from Susan Ramsey; new theme teases from Ryan Townley, WP Studio and Brian Gardner; plus, awesome tutorials from Carrie Dils and Robin Cornett.

(Plus, if you’re interested in seeing your name in GenesisWP.guide lights, check out this week’s PS 😉 )

Andiamo!

Themes

First up this week, I’m very excited to share the first ever theme launch from Genesis community legend Susan Ramsey. Called Elise, not only does it have a fantastic design, it’s e-commerce ready and you can name your own price too. Check Elise out now over on the Pretty Darn Cute Designs website.

I'm so excited for @onehappystudio – her first theme launch is imminent… 🙂 #genesiswp ?

— Lindsey Riel (@lindseyriel) October 23, 2015

My first #WordPress theme has been released! Thanks to the #GenesisWP for your awesome support! https://t.co/1uBHcWbVat

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) October 23, 2015

Next up, in theme teases, WP Studio with this promising looking Genesis theme entitled Forest.

Working on my next Genesis WordPress theme. https://t.co/ikWUeDrCK4 #genesiswp #wordpress

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) October 21, 2015

Plus, a new theme in the works from Ryan Townley over at Minimal Genesis, looking to incorporate great portfolio support out of the box.

Working on a new #genesiswp theme to integrate with Woo Projects. Have fine art galleries in mind but useful for others who need a portoflio

— Minimal Genesis (@minimalgenesis) October 17, 2015

So far Jetpack Portfolio support is playing a lot nicer with #genesiswp than Woo Projects.

— Minimal Genesis (@minimalgenesis) October 21, 2015

And, finally some chap called Brian Gardner teasing us with the M Theme.

Always creating. http://t.co/BmngnbXb0z #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) October 17, 2015

Showcase

First up this week, a random showcase discovery from StudioPress’ Lauren Mancke on her travels, huntergathererbrewery.com (that’s using the Cafe Pro theme, in case you were wondering).

When you're looking up the menu enroute to your date and the restaurant is using your theme 🙂 Nice site @hgbrewery https://t.co/JFq9QTwH5u

— Lauren Mancke (@laurenmancke) October 20, 2015

…a great new blog design from Patricia Alix Villa for thecreatologist.com

New blog design project launched! Do check out https://t.co/0uceZm3Nr2! #WordPress #genesiswp #blogdesign

— Patricia Alix Villa (@PatFancyGirl) October 23, 2015

…nice, clean new site from the good people over at Bourn Creative for cypresscapitalventures.com (even if they don’t use the #genesiswp hashtag that much anymore 😉 )

@cswordpress we don't really anymore … with that said though, we did just launch this #genesiswp site https://t.co/ix1WiiABK3 😉 😉

— Jennifer Bourn (@jenniferbourn) October 21, 2015

And finally, in the showcase this week, an elegant new site from CreativeVisualDesign for lesliestephensdesign.com

New website for Leslie Stephens Design in #rva https://t.co/vnOX2tG4jX #webdesign #rwd #genesiswp #WordPress pic.twitter.com/dYJsSdwf86

— CreativeVisualDesign (@CreativeVisual) October 21, 2015

Podcasts

The UK Genesis Podcast was back in full force this week with guest Dave Dean chatting to Gary Jones and Jo Waltham about his new genesis development framework (Musket) amongst other pressing topics.

Our guest today is @wpmusketeer. The shows starts in 30 minutes: https://t.co/VEFUX31ryX #genesiswp #ukgenesis pic.twitter.com/3hEWd0yHKS

— UK Genesis (@UKGenesis) October 21, 2015

Meanwhile, over at the good ship OfficeHours.fm, Carrie Dils was chatting to Troy Dean of WP Elevation who was dropping some WordPress consultancy value bombs in a special, pre-recorded episode.

Best of the rest

GenesisWP.guide favourite (yes, favourite) Robin Cornett with a great post on Harnessing the Power of Genesis Archive Options. (And there’s a lot of power in there, let me tell you).

Harness the Power of Genesis Archive Options http://t.co/CSo5Cprc5J

— Robin Cornett (@robincornett) October 19, 2015

Not directly Genesis related (OMG!), but had to share this great post from the legendary Carrie Dils on Uncluttering the (WordPress) Admin Experience.

Uncluttering the Admin Experience https://t.co/OcrMRCsFyv

— carrie dils (@cdils) October 20, 2015

And finally…

Congrats to one of the earliest supporters of this website, Calvin Koepke on officially joining the Rainmaker crew (the folks behind StudioPress, the Rainmaker Platform and other great Genesis products and services) this week. Nice work brother 🙂

Pleased to announce that @cjkoepke has officially joined us at @RainmakerHQ.

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) October 22, 2015

That’s all for this week. It’s been emotional, but I’ll be back next week (probably) with more Genesis news and entertainment for you.

In the meantime, stay cool and subscribe, subscribe, subscribe if you didn’t already.

Have a great weekend.

PS In an effort to make GenesisWP.guide more community awesome, I’m considering opening up GenesisWP.guide to outside contributors. If you’re interested in (potentially) seeing your name in lights drop me a note.

excerpt.rendered: A fantastic new theme from Susan Ramsey; design teases from Ryan Townley, WP Studio and Brian Gardner; plus epic tutorials from Carrie Dils and Robin Cornett.
